text:
Hi!
I am Michele from Italy. I am junior research assistant pursuing my MSc in Computer Science in Milan.  I have stepped into Julia last year during an internship in Antwerp. This event quickly arose my interest in HPC and Scientific Computing :slightly_smiling_face:
I am eager to join the effort of the community :slightly_smiling_face: and contribute to the development of the julia environment.
I might consider Gsoc, but I haven't decided yet.
Cheers

text:
Who's doing Julia in Antwerp?
<@UB7JS9CHF> used to work for a company based there that was using Julia, but I think they stopped a few years ago.

elements.text: used to work for a company based there that was using Julia, but I think they stopped a few years ago.

text: <@U6A936746> The Computational Mathematics laboratory of Antwerp University was interested in Julia. It was an Erasmus Internship involving both the Computer Science dep. and the Physics dep, therefore it was university-wise. No news about the industry status around the diamond city, sorry :disappointed:

elements.text: The Computational Mathematics laboratory of Antwerp University was interested in Julia. It was an Erasmus Internship involving both the Computer Science dep. and the Physics dep, therefore it was university-wise. No news about the industry status around the diamond city, sorry

text:
Yes, I loved going to Antwerp.  I spent 3 years working for a startup based there (with some people I’d worked closely with for 4 years at the place I had been previously for 29 years, after their previous startup had been purchased by that company).
I know there are a number of top-notch Julians in that area!
